parameter.name: max_buffer_interval
parameter.description: A buffer of 3 hours in seconds.

parameter.name: max_pick_delay
parameter.description: Maximal delay between picks in clusters.

parameter.name: max_pick_distance
parameter.description: Maximal distance between picked streams in clusters. Levels station, location and channel are supported.

parameter.name: min_pick_distance
parameter.description: Minimal distance between picked streams in clusters.

parameter.name: min_released_clustered_picks
parameter.description: Minimal number of picks in clusters.

parameter.name: test
parameter.description: If true nothing get sent (superseeds all other options).

parameter.name: release_todatabase
parameter.description: If true origins go only to messaging system, not to database (no public ID).

parameter.name: release_cluster
parameter.description: If true clusters are released as preliminary origin.

parameter.name: release_location
parameter.description: If true cluster origin locations (not implemented) are released.

parameter.name: enable_loc_clust
parameter.description: Enables clustering using all location codes of the same station as independent picks. Useful if station code is the same for distant instrument with different location code.

parameter.name: enable_cha_clust
parameter.description: Enables clustering using all channel codes of the same station as independent picks. Useful if chanel level has coordinates (not in SED-ETHZ) and location code is the same for distant instrument.

parameter.name: enable_same_id_clust
parameter.description: Enables clustering using picks of the same stream as independent picks. Useful if the same stream should contribute several time to origin.

option.description: Do not write to database (do not create public id for sent object).
Name of input file with all picks for offline processing. Results are sent in XML to stdout. Read picks from file instead of messaging system. Use '-' to read from stdin. This option implies --test.
Input format to use (xml [default], zxml (zipped xml), binary). Only relevant with --ep.
Write origins to specific XML file instead of stdout. Only relevant with --ep.
